$$$NOTE1.text:
Subject:       Dynamic ISPF Starter Set (DISS) V3R5 announcement
Date:          Tue, 2 Jul 2002 16:25:17 -0400
From:          "Thomas Conley" <pinnacle@frontiernet.net>
Organization:  Pinnacle Consulting Group, Inc.
         To:   "Thomas Conley" <pinnacle@frontiernet.net>
         CC:   "ISPF discussion list" <ISPF-L@listserv.nd.edu>,
               "TSOREXX" <TSO-REXX@VM.MARIST.EDU>,
               "ibmmain" <ibm-main@bama.ua.edu>

I am pleased to announce the new V3R5 release of the Dynamic ISPF
Starter Set.  This is a small maintenance release with the
following features:

- New @QMFV6 exec which eliminates the need to use Dynamic
  STEPLIB to support multiple QMF subsystems for QMF V6 and
  higher
- Miscellaneous fixes and documentation enhancements

This release of DISS was made possible by the help and
contributions of the following people and their employers:

Vikesh Bhoola
James Campbell
Eddie Collins at Brookshire Grocery Co.
Alastair Gray at Philip Morris
Jim Halley at Zurich Financial Services
Jim Horne at Lowe's
Bob Iappini at Texaco
Phil Knight at AIG
Bob Lawrence at Boscov's Department Stores LLc
Ken Tomiak at Schunk and Associates
Jerry Whitteridge at Safeway

You can download DISS from my Website below, and it will also be
available soon as FILE495 at www.cbttape.org.  Please let me know
if you have any questions or concerns regarding DISS.

If you're reading this from the listserver and you want to be
added to the mailing list, send me an Email and I will add you.
If you wish to be removed from this mailing list, send me an
Email indicating that and I will remove you immediately.

$$$NOTE2.text:
Subject: New DISS V3R6 release announcement
Date: Wed, 9 Oct 2002 18:36:56 -0400
From: "Thomas Conley" <pinnacle@frontiernet.net>
Organization: Pinnacle Consulting Group, Inc.
To: "Thomas Conley" <pinnacle@frontiernet.net>

I am pleased to announce the new V3R6 release of the Dynamic ISPF
Starter Set.  Now featuring nearly 140 execs, the Starter Set has
some significant new functionality over the previous V3R5
release:

- Support for 9 new applications
    - FDR, ABR, and UPSTREAM from Innovation
    - (E)JES from Phoenix Software
    - IPCS dialogs for TCP/IP and IMS
    - CA's OPERA and TLMS
    - CICS Message Editing Utility
- New DTL sample for z/OS V1R2 enhancements
- Modify IPCS, IPCS/JES2, IPCS/JES3 for multiple
  release support
- Improved error processing for &ZPRIM=NO panels
- Fixes for other applications

Be sure to review the $CHANGES member for all the new release
features.

This release of DISS was made possible by the help and
contributions of the following people and their employers:

Ed Jaffe at Phoenix Software International
Phil Knight at AIG
Fran×ois Le Maner at GIE Loricam
Gilbert Saint-flour at ConvTek

I'd like to take this opportunity to thank Gilbert Saint-flour
for allowing me to develop and test DISS on his P390 platform.
From the first release in June of 2000 until now, Gilbert's P390
has always been there.  I've got my own P390 now and I've
transitioned development and testing over to it, but DISS
wouldn't be what it is today without Gilbert's support these past
two years.  Merci beaucoup, mon ami.

You can download DISS from my Website below, and it will also be
available soon as FILE495 at www.cbttape.org.  Please let me know
if you have any questions or concerns regarding DISS.

$$$NOTE3.text:
Subject: New DISS release V3R9 announcement
Date: Mon, 7 Jul 2003 18:36:10 -0400
From: "Thomas Conley" <pinnacle@frontiernet.net>
To: "ibmmain" <ibm-main@bama.ua.edu>,
     "TSOREXX" <TSO-REXX@VM.MARIST.EDU>,
     "ISPF discussion list" <ISPF-L@listserv.nd.edu>

I am pleased to announce the new V3R9 release of the Dynamic ISPF
Starter Set.  Now featuring over 180 members, the Starter Set has
some significant new functionality over the previous V3R8
release:

- Support for 7 new applications
    - AbendAid
    - CA-VTAPE
    - CA-Deliver
    - CA-PDSMAN
    - Logrec Viewer
    - XDC
    - XPATH

- Fix bugs in the RMF dialog to add STACK to all LIBDEFs and
allow RMF Primary Option Menu ERB0PRM to process nested menu
selections

- Modify $DYNMENU to circumvent the 126-pair limit for the TRANS
  function
- Modify TSOLOGON for better comments
- Modify @ISHELL to add keylist support
- Modify @FFST for IBM standard dataset names
- Modify @DITTO to free DITPROF file allocated by DITTO command
  processor
- Modify @VIEW to use ZTRAIL for passing the VIEW database name
- Modify @IPCSTC2 to comment out keylist support if PQ74283 is
  applied
- Modify @ZEKE to remove LIBDEF for ISPLLIB and add documentation
  for putting ZEKE loadlib in LINKLIST or Dynamic STEPLIB

Be sure to review the $CHANGES member for all the new release
features and $INSTALL member for installation instructions.

This release of DISS was made possible by the help and
contributions of the following people and their employers:

Duane Weaver at Ohio State University

You can download DISS from my Website below, and it will also be
available soon as FILE495 at www.cbttape.org.  Please let me know

$BOOKINS.text:
Currently, BookManager READ does not fully support ALTLIB and LIBDEF for
invoking BookManager READ.  Here is IBM's position on this issue:

APAR PN20713 states IBM's official position that BookManager READ does
not support LIBDEF's.  PN20713 goes on to state that IBM will not
support anyone wishing to use LIBDEF when invoking BookManager READ.
IBM cites four reasons as the basis for denying LIBDEF support in
BookManager READ.  In a Dynamic ISPF environment, only one of the four
reasons is valid.  The fourth reason listed in PN20713 describes the
BookManager "Edit source" function.  This function performs a split
screen and brings up an edit session so the user can directly edit the
manual they're working with.  This function will not work because the
LIBDEF's are not carried across the split screen.  If you require the
"Edit source" function in BookManager, you will have to create a LOGON
proc and hard allocate the BookManager datasets.  If you do not require
the "Edit source" function, this exec will correctly invoke BookManager
READ, but you do so at your own risk.  IBM will not support any dialog
errors you encounter unless you have hard allocated datasets in a LOGON
PROC.

That said, in order to support BookManager, you will need to either
concatenate this library first in the ALTLIB statement in the @BOOKRED
exec, or you will have to copy BOOKMGR, EOXBKMGR, EOXREDIT, and
EOXVHELP to another exec library and concatenate that library first
in the ALTLIB statement in the @BOOKRED exec.  You may also create an
AMP/E usermod to install these changes.

<:-- * * * * * * * * * * ISR@PRIM Customization * * * * * * * * * * *-->
<:--                                                                 -->
<:-- The following ENTITYs define members shipped in the ISPGMLI     -->
<:-- library that are provided for customization purposes.           -->
<:--                                                                 -->
<:-- Except for the panel title line (member ISR@PUTI),              -->
<:-- each member contains only comments to outline the type of       -->
<:-- tag(s) to be used in that member.                               -->
<:--                                                                 -->
<:-- The ENTITY, VARCLASS, VARDCL and CHOICE files are included      -->
<:-- after all standard ISR@PRIM definitions. Three panel logic      -->
<:-- files are provided to add logic (1) before any standard ISR@PRIM-->
<:-- logic, (2) after ISR@PRIM logic but before the ZSEL generated   -->
<:-- statement, or (3) after the ZSEL generated statement.           -->
<:--                                                                 -->
<:-- The ISPGMLI members and their functions are:                    -->
<:--   isr@puen - ENTITY imbed                                       -->
<:--   isr@puvc - VARCLASS/XLATL/CHECK tags                          -->
<:--   isr@puvd - VARDCL tags                                        -->
<:--   isr@puop - CHOICE/ACTION tags                                 -->
<:--   isr@pul1 - panel logic / SOURCE tags (1)                      -->
<:--   isr@pul2 - panel logic / SOURCE tags (2)                      -->
<:--   isr@pul3 - panel logic / SOURCE tags (3)                      -->
<:--   isr@puti - panel title line                                   -->
<:--                                                                 -->
<:-- To use this customization feature, either:                      -->
<:--   1. Create your own members using the same member names and    -->
<:--      place them in a local library.                             -->
<:--                                                                 -->
<:--              ... or ...                                         -->
<:--                                                                 -->
<:--   2. Create your own members using any member name in a local   -->
<:--      library. Change the member names in the following ENTITY   -->
<:--      definitions to specify your local member names.            -->
<:--                                                                 -->
<:-- Concatenate the local library in front of the ISPF product      -->
<:-- libraries in your ISPDTLC JCL or on the ISPDTLC invocation      -->
<:-- panel.                                                          -->
<:--                                                                 -->
<:--    ISR@PRIM entity    ISPGMLI                                   -->
<:--    internal name      member name                               -->
<:--          |                |                                     -->
  <:ENTITY loclenti system "isr@puen" -- ENTITY imbed                -->
  <:ENTITY loclvarc system "isr@puvc" -- VARCLASS/XLATL/CHECK tags   -->
  <:ENTITY loclvard system "isr@puvd" -- VARDCL tags                 -->
  <:ENTITY loclopts system "isr@puop" -- CHOICE/ACTION tags          -->
  <:ENTITY locllog1 system "isr@pul1" -- panel logic / <SOURCE> tags -->
  <:ENTITY locllog2 system "isr@pul2" -- panel logic / <SOURCE> tags -->
  <:ENTITY locllog3 system "isr@pul3" -- panel logic / <SOURCE> tags -->
  <:ENTITY locltitl system "isr@puti" -- panel title line tags       -->
<:-- End of customization ENTITY definitions.                        -->

*                                                                     *

***********************************************************************

* Review $DYNMENU changes to support more than 126 menu options.      *
*                                                                     *
* Review $DYNMENU invocation changes for @VIEW and @DELIVER to        *
* pass the database dataset name in the ztrail argument to each exec. *

*                                                                     *

*                                                                     *
***********************************************************************

*                                                                     *
* Review and test changes for @SDSF after installing the @SDSF1 stub. *
*                                                                     *
* For z/OS V1R4, the @VTAMDMP and @VTAMTRC execs for VTAM dump and    *
* trace analysis have been modified for the updated packaging and to  *
* use stubs @VTAMDM1 and @VTAMTR1.                                    *

* There are ISPF applications that require keylist support, but do    *
* not provide support by setting ZKLUSE to "Y".  In the past, the     *
* Starter Set has distributed customized vendor execs to provide this *
* support, but in the future, all keylist applications will be        *
* suppoted by creating stubs to enable PFSHOW and KEYLIST support.    *
*                                                                     *
* Review and test changes for @SDSF after installing the @SDSF1 stub. *
*                                                                     *
* For MQSeries, there are two different installs.  At MQSeries V5R3   *
* and higher, use the @MQSRS53 exec, and make sure you do NOT use the *
* customized CSQOREXX exec in the Starter Set.  MQSeries added the    *
* STACK parm to their LIBDEFs, so you can use the IBM-supplied        *
* CSQOREXX.  At MQSeries V5R2 and lower, use the new @MQSRS52 exec,   *
* and make sure you do use the customized CSQOREXX exec, which has    *
* been modified to only add STACK to the LIBDEFs.  The PFSHOW and     *
* ZKLUSE settings are now performed in the modified @MQSRIES stub.    *
*                                                                     *
***********************************************************************
*                                                                     *
* V3R7 Release - November 3, 2002                                     *
*                                                                     *
* Implement new TSOLOGON REXX exec and eliminate LOGON CLISTs.        *
*                                                                     *
***********************************************************************
*                                                                     *
* V3R6 Release - October 9, 2002                                      *
*                                                                     *
* For the JESx IPCS dialogs, be sure to read the comments regarding   *
* the concatenation of SYS1.SHASPARM and SYS1.SIATPARM to your        *
* default PARMLIB concatenation.                                      *
*                                                                     *
* For the TCP/IP IPCS dialog, you will have to execute @IPCSTC1 to    *
* begin the IPCS dialog.  In the IPCS dialog, go to IPCS option 6 and *
* enter the @IPCSTC2 command.  In addtion to enabling keylists and    *
* PFSHOW, an EZBDCMDS member has also been created to allow IPCS      *
* commands to be issued from the TCP/IP IPCS dialog.  This will       *
* actually make the dialog usable.                                    *
*                                                                     *
* For ABRALLOC, be sure to change FDRPREF to your FDR prefix and make *
* sure all the dataset names in the PROC statement are correct.       *
*                                                                     *
* For @CA11, be sure to modify the new C11IEXEC for your CA-11        *
* dataset names.  There are three dataset names to be changed on      *
* lines 42, 44, and 47.                                               *
*                                                                     *
* For $DYNDT12, be sure to NOT include ISR@PUL2, otherwise you will   *
* get duplicate ZSEL logic.  ISR@PUL2 is only required prior to       *
* z/OS V1R2.  For z/OS V1R2 and higher, the selcheck operand of the   *
* selfld directive generates the corrected ZSEL checking code in DTL. *
*                                                                     *
* Be sure to review the $CHANGES member and run a compare between     *
* your exec library and the DISS exec library, then incorporate the   *
* changes as necessary.                                               *
*                                                                     *
***********************************************************************
*                                                                     *
* V3R5 Release - July 2, 2002                                         *
*                                                                     *
* Apply OW53891, delete customized IWMARIN1 exec, and install the new *
* @WLM exec.                                                          *
*                                                                     *
* For QMF, ensure you install the correct version, @QMFV6 for QMF V6  *
* and later, or @QMF for releases prior to QMF V6.                    *
*                                                                     *
* For QMF, ensure that @QMFV6 is invoked with the correct subsystem   *
* id.                                                                 *
*                                                                     *
* For CA-LIBRARIAN, check the comments in the @CALIBR exec.           *
*                                                                     *
* Be sure to review the $CHANGES member and run a compare between     *
* your exec library and the DISS exec library, then incorporate the   *
* changes as necessary.                                               *
*                                                                     *
***********************************************************************
*                                                                     *
* V3R4 Release - May 12, 2002                                         *
*                                                                     *
* Install the customized IWMARIN1 exec to correct problems with the   *
* IBM version.  You should install it with an SMP/E usermod so you    *

*                                                                     *
* Be sure to review the $CHANGES member and run a compare between     *
* your exec library and the DISS exec library, then incorporate the   *
* changes as necessary.                                               *
*                                                                     *
* If installing @$AVRS either new or as a modification, be sure to    *

*                                                                     *
***********************************************************************
*                                                                     *
* V3R2 Release - November 17, 2001                                    *
*                                                                     *
* For this new release, the DTL samples $DYNDTL and ISR@PUL2 were     *
* added.  If you wish to modify and compile this sample, be sure to   *
* include the ISP.SISPGENU and ISP.SISPGMLI libraries in the ISPDTLC  *

*                                                                     *
* Install the customized CSQOREXX exec to correct problems with the   *
* IBM version.  You should install it with an SMP/E usermod so you    *
* can be notified of any changes IBM makes to CSQOREXX.               *
*                                                                     *
* Be sure to review the $CHANGES member and run a compare between     *
* your exec library and the DISS exec library, then incorporate the   *
* changes as necessary.                                               *
*                                                                     *
***********************************************************************
*                                                                     *
* V3R1 Release - July 31, 2001                                        *
*                                                                     *
* For the V3R1 release, you will have to make changes to your         *
* selection menus and command tables if you use them.  In the )PROC   *
* section of your panels or in the command section of your command    *
* tables, remove all SCRNAME parms you may have coded there.  The     *

* Since nearly every EXEC has changed to incorporate SCRNAME, and     *
* other execs have been modified to correct errors or add function,   *
* review the $CHANGES member and run a compare between your exec      *
* library and the DISS exec library, then incorporate the changes as  *
* necessary.                                                          *
*                                                                     *
***********************************************************************
*                                                                     *
* V3R0 Release - May 25, 2001                                         *
*                                                                     *
* For the V3R0, BookManager support was added.  Please read the       *
* $BOOKINS member in order to install BookManager support and to be   *

*                                                                     *
* As usual, read the $CHANGES member, then compare your exec library  *
* to the DISS exec library and incorporate any changes you need.      *
*
***********************************************************************

$README.text:
Dynamic ISPF is a methodology to eliminate ISPF datasets from TSO logon
procs by using the dynamic allocation functions of ISPF and TSO to
allocate ISPF application datasets instead.  For more information about
Dynamic ISPF, download Tom Conley's Dynamic ISPF SHARE presentation at
http://home.roadrunner.com/~pinncons.

This starter set includes REXX execs to invoke many standard ISPF
applications.  If you have any problems, suggestions, or to contribute
an exec of yours, please Email Tom Conley:

     pinncons@rochester.rr.com

This exec library will be updated periodically and reposted at:

http://home.roadrunner.com/~pinncons
http://www.cbttape.org


In order to understand and install the varied components of the Dynamic
ISPF Starter Set, refer to the following members:

$BOOKINS - Documentation and installation instructions for Dynamic ISPF
           BookManager Support.
$CHANGES - Change log for each release of Dynamic ISPF.
$DYNMENU - Example of a dynamically scrolling menu with invocations for
           each exec in the Dynamic ISPF Starter Set.
$FILE495 - Inventory and summary of this FILE495 on the CBTTape.
$INSTALL - Installation instructions for each release.
$README  - This member.
$READWAC - Documentation and installation instructions for the World
           According to Conley (WAC) method for setting up ISPF.

$READWAC.text:
This member describes the WAC (World According to Conley) method for
implementing TSO and ISPF.  This is a simple, straightforward method
that allows you to quickly and easily implement ISPF, or streamline an
existing ISPF implementation.  Complicated LOGON CLISTs, LOGON PROCs,
and ISPF selection menus are replaced with a simple set of building
blocks which get you going quickly.  You can add complexity if you want,
but you won't need to.

WAC has only one prerequisite.  It assumes that you have good TSO USERID
naming standards, and that all users are segregated into appropriate
groups based on their job responsibilities.  Without TSO USERID's
clearly delineated by job responsibility, WAC will not yield the desired
results.

Before we continue, let me clarify that WAC is a separate concept from
Dynamic ISPF.  They dovetail together, but it is important to remember
that Dynamic ISPF is the methodology that removes datasets from the
LOGON PROC.  ISPF apps run by using REXX execs and the TSO/ISPF dynamic
allocation facilities to allocate ISPF libraries and invoke ISPF
appliations.  WAC is a methodology for setting up the overall TSO LOGON
environment.  WAC is based on using a minimal LOGON CLIST and the TSO
LOGON PROC names to completely create the users TSO environment.  Other
issues such as security, using command tables instead of panels, etc.
are all described in the Dynamic ISPF methodology.

So let's get started.  Here are the sample members that make up WAC:

$READWAC - This member.
ALLUSER  - Sample panel of company-wide ISPF options for all users.
IKJTSO00 - WAC sample of TSO PARMLIB member for HELP datasets
ISR@PRIM - WAC sample of ISPF Primary Option Menu with A & Z options
TSOLOGON - WAC sample of a LOGON CLIST
OY59638  - IBM APAR showing why LOGON parm should always be a CLIST
TSOAPPL  - WAC sample of TSO LOGON PROC for Applications
TSOAPPL# - WAC sample of ISPF selection menu for Applications
TSOSYSP  - WAC sample of TSO LOGON PROC for SysProgs
TSOSYSP# - WAC sample of ISPF selection menu for SysProgs
UMISPFP  - WAC sample of ISPF usermod for ISR@PRIM

To install WAC, perform the following steps:

1.  Create a LOGON proc for each group based on the PROC samples in
    TSOAPPL and TSOSYSP.
2.  Create a LOGON CLIST based on the sample in LOGON, and execute it
    in the PARM= statement for the IKJEFT01 step in the LOGON PROCs
    created in step 1 (you may need to change the ISPF profile dataset
    name to match your standards).
3.  Customize and run the UMISPFP usermod sample to customize ISR@PRIM
    (or if you prefer, just slap the ISR@PRIM sample into your ISPPLIB
    concatenation).
4.  Install the ALLUSER sample panel for company-wide ISPF applications
    (or whichever name you may choose for this option) into your ISPPLIB
    concatenation.
5.  Rename the TSOAPPL# and TSOSYSP# samples by removing the '#' and
    install them into your ISPPLIB concatenation.  Customize the panels
    with the ISPF applications that will be invoked by that group.
6.  Pull the plug on your old ISPF methods.
7.  Hit yourself in the head and wonder why you didn't do this sooner.

Following is some detailed documentation regarding the WAC samples.

Let's start with the TSO LOGON PROCs.  There are two samples, TSOAPPL
for application programmers, and TSOSYSP for system programmers.  You'll
notice that each PROC is identical, differing only in the member name
and STEPNAME on the IKJEFT01 step.  The STEPNAME will be stored in the
&ZLOGON ISPF variable.  We will use &ZLOGON later to determine a
group-specific ISPF application menu.  You will need to create a LOGON
PROC for each group in your shop.

In these LOGON PROC samples, take note of the minimal dataset
allocations.  All you should have here are system-specific datasets and
ISPF datasets.  If you do not have a system-wide CLIST library (like
SYS2.ISPCLIB), allocate one and place it in the SYSPROC concatenation of
all your LOGON PROCs.  This is the library that will hold the Dynamic
ISPF REXX Driver EXECs.

You may notice the lack of a SYSHELP concatenation.  The SYSHELP
datasets are defined in the IKJTSO00 member of PARMLIB, and will be used
for all TSO sessions.  There is a sample IKJTSO00 member to show you how
to allocate the SYSHELP datasets in the PARMLIB member.  This method has
two advantages:  the SYSHELP datasets are all defined in a central
location; and the SYSHELP datasets are only allocated if the user enters
the HELP command, saving resources.  The disadvantage is for sites
wishing to control access to the datasets in the SYSHELP concatenation.
If your site does not want the user to access TCP/IP help, for example,
then you would add the SYSHELP DD to the LOGON proc, and exclude the
SEZAHELP dataset from SYSHELP.

The next piece is the TSO logon EXEC member TSOLOGON.  In the past,
logon EXEC's were not possible due to limitations documented in APAR
OY59638.  Ken Burrow at Computer Sciences Corporation developed the
technique of using the REXX QUEUE (or PUSH) command to have ISPF,
TSOLIB, etc.  execute from the TSO READY prompt.  That circumvents
OY59638, which finally allows us to jettison CLISTs (YES!!) for LOGON
processing.  Thank you Ken!

Note what you do not see in the LOGON EXEC.  No freeing and
reallocating datasets.  No use of CONCAT or other tools to concatenate
datasets.  No allocating user ISPF datasets.  If you still need to
create a personal ISPF environment for your users, introduce them to
ISPF option 6, and show them the sample exec in member PERSISPF.  They
can customize PERSISPF and invoke it from ISPF option 6 to create their
own ISPF environment.  The only limitation with this method is lack of
support for ISPF applications requiring STEPLIB.  If the user's personal
ISPF environment requires STEPLIB support (tell them to use SELECT PGM
instead of CALL/LINK/ATTACH/XCTL ;-), they will either need to use a
Dynamic STEPLIB product, or they'll have to exit ISPF, enter the TSOLIB
command for the STEPLIB from the READY prompt, re-enter ISPF, then
re-execute PERSISPF from option 6 (see how much easier it would be to
use SELECT PGM?).  These comments are only directed towards new ISPF
application development.  Unfortunately we are stuck with a lot of
legacy dialog code that uses the CALL/LINK/ATTACH/XCTL interface.  But
that's no excuse for not making sure new dialog development uses
SELECT PGM instead of CALL/LINK/ATTACH/XCTL.

Next up is the Primary Option Menu.  Two samples are provided, ISR@PRIM
for the sloppy SysProgs who don't believe in SMP/E, and usermod UMISPFP
for SysProgs who like to do things the right way.  Both samples show the
addition of an "A" option for ALL Users, a company-wide option menu for
ISPF applications to be accessed by everyone, and a "Z" option menu for
ISPF applications to be accessed by that group (based on the &ZLOGON
variable from the LOGON PROC step name).  A common modification is to
change the "A" option to the first letter of the company name (e.g. "P"
for Pinnacle Consulting Group, Inc., or "W" for Widgets, Inc.).  You'll
often also see an "S" option for SDSF or another spool viewer product.

Lastly, you have the sample panel members ALLUSER, TSOAPPL#, and
TSOSYSP#.  These samples show how to code the "A" and "Z" option menus.
For TSOAPPL# or TSOSYSP#, remove the '#' sign before placing the members
in your ISPPLIB concatenation.

@ABNDAID.text:
/* rexx */
/*********************************************************************/
/* This exec invokes COMPUWARE's ABENDAID Dialog.  It is provided    */
/* courtesy of Duane Weaver at The Ohio State University.            */
/*********************************************************************/
parse arg zcmd
address ispexec "LIBDEF ISPMLIB DATASET STACK",
                "ID('COMPWARE.MLCX830.SLCXMENU')"
address ispexec "LIBDEF ISPPLIB DATASET STACK",
                "ID('COMPWARE.MLCX830.SLCXPENU')"
address ispexec "LIBDEF ISPSLIB DATASET STACK",
                "ID('COMPWARE.MLCX830.SLCXSENU')"
address ispexec "SELECT PGM(CWDDSUTL) NEWAPPL(AAUT) PARM(SPF) PASSLIB",
                "SCRNAME(ABENDAID)"
address ispexec "LIBDEF ISPMLIB"
address ispexec "LIBDEF ISPPLIB"
address ispexec "LIBDEF ISPSLIB"

@APA.text:
/* rexx */
/*trace i*/
/*********************************************************************/
/* This exec invokes IBM's Application Performance Analyzer dialog.  */
/*********************************************************************/
parse arg ztrail
address ispexec "LIBDEF ISPLLIB DATASET ID('apapref.SCAZAUTH'",
                                          "'apapref.SCAZLINK') STACK"
address ispexec "LIBDEF ISPMLIB DATASET ID('apapref.SCAZMENU') STACK"
address ispexec "LIBDEF ISPPLIB DATASET ID('apapref.SCAZPENU') STACK"
address ispexec "LIBDEF ISPTLIB DATASET ID('apapref.SCAZTENU') STACK"
address tso "ALTLIB ACT APPLICATION(EXEC) DATASET('apapref.SCAZEXEC')"
address ispexec "SELECT CMD(CALL *(CAZPMSEL)) NEWAPPL(CAZ3) PASSLIB",
                "MODE(FSCR) SCRNAME(APA)"
address ispexec "LIBDEF ISPLLIB"
address ispexec "LIBDEF ISPPLIB"
address ispexec "LIBDEF ISPMLIB"
address ispexec "LIBDEF ISPTLIB"
address tso "ALTLIB DEACT APPLICATION(EXEC)"

@APPC.text:
/* rexx */
/* trace i */
/*********************************************************************/
/* This exec invokes IBM's APPC administration dialog.               */
/*********************************************************************/
parse arg ztrail
address tso "ALTLIB ACT APPL(CLIST) DA('ICQ.ICQCCLIB')"
address ispexec "LIBDEF ISPMLIB DATASET ID('ICQ.ICQMLIB') STACK"
address ispexec "LIBDEF ISPPLIB DATASET ID('ICQ.ICQPLIB') STACK"
address ispexec "LIBDEF ISPSLIB DATASET ID('ICQ.ICQSLIB') STACK"
address ispexec "LIBDEF ISPTLIB DATASET ID('ICQ.ICQTLIB') STACK"
address ispexec "SELECT CMD(%ICQASRM0) SCRNAME(APPCADM)"
address ispexec "LIBDEF ISPMLIB"
address ispexec "LIBDEF ISPPLIB"
address ispexec "LIBDEF ISPSLIB"
address ispexec "LIBDEF ISPTLIB"
address tso "ALTLIB DEACT APPL(CLIST)"

@ASTEX.text:
/* rexx */
/* trace i */
/*********************************************************************/
/* This exec invokes CA's ASTEX dialog.  This exec is provided       */
/* courtesy of Bob Richards at the Bennett Group.                    */
/*********************************************************************/
address tso "ALLOC FI(ASXDUMMY) DUMMY"
if rc > 0 then
   do
      address ispexec "LIBDEF ISPMLIB DATASET ID('astexprf.ISPMLIB')",
                      "STACK"
      address ispexec "SETMSG MSG(ASX547)"
      address ispexec "LIBDEF ISPMLIB"
      exit
   end
address tso "ALLOC FI(CTRANS) DA('astexprf.LOAD') SHR"
address ispexec "LIBDEF ISPLLIB DATASET ID('astexprf.LOAD')    STACK"
address ispexec "LIBDEF ISPMLIB DATASET ID('astexprf.ISPMLIB') STACK"
address ispexec "LIBDEF ISPPLIB DATASET ID('astexprf.ISPPLIB') STACK"
address ispexec "LIBDEF ISPSLIB DATASET ID('astexprf.ISPSLIB') STACK"
address ispexec "SELECT PGM(ASXTSOM) NEWAPPL(ASX$) PASSLIB",
                "SCRNAME(ASTEX)"
address ispexec "ISPEXEC LIBDEF ISPLLIB"
address ispexec "ISPEXEC LIBDEF ISPMLIB"
address ispexec "ISPEXEC LIBDEF ISPPLIB"
address ispexec "ISPEXEC LIBDEF ISPSLIB"
address tso "FREE F(ASXDUMMY)"
address tso "FREE F(CTRANS)"

@AXCIS.text:
/* rexx */
/*********************************************************************/
/* This exec invokes Kodak's AXCIS ISPF dialog.                      */
/*********************************************************************/

/* rexx */
/* trace i */
/*********************************************************************/
/* This exec invokes Serena's Comparex dialog.  It is provided       */
/* courtesy of Phil Knight at AIG.                                   */
/*********************************************************************/
parse arg ztrail
address tso "ALLOC FI(CPXLLIB) DA('comparex.pref.LOADLIB') SHR"
address tso "ALTLIB ACT APPL(CLIST) DA('comparex.pref.CLIST')"
address ispexec "LIBDEF ISPLLIB DATASET ID('comparex.pref.LOADLIB')",
                "STACK"
address ispexec "LIBDEF ISPMLIB DATASET ID('comparex.pref.MSGS') STACK"
address ispexec "LIBDEF ISPPLIB DATASET ID('comparex.pref.PANELS')",
                "STACK"
address ispexec "LIBDEF ISPTLIB DATASET ID('comparex.pref.TABLES')",
                "STACK"
address ispexec "LIBDEF ISPTABL DATASET ID('comparex.pref.TABLES')",
                "STACK"
/*********************************************************************/
/* The following code is wrapped around the SELECT PANEL to prevent  */
/* dialog termination if ztrail contains an invalid option.  Instead */
/* of the ISPF dialog termination panel, the "Invalid option" error  */
/* message will be displayed.  This is only necessary for            */
/* non-primary option menus (menus defined with &ZPRIM=NO in the     */
/* )INIT section of the panel) using the IBM default ZSEL syntax.    */
/*********************************************************************/
address ispexec "CONTROL ERRORS RETURN"
do forever
   address ispexec "SELECT PANEL(CPX@PRIM) OPT("ztrail") NEWAPPL(CPX)",
                   "NEWPOOL PASSLIB SCRNAME(COMPAREX)"
   if rc <= 4 then
      leave
   else
      do
         address ispexec "SETMSG MSG("zerrmsg")"
         if zerrmsg <> 'ISPD221' then
            leave
      end
   ztrail = ''
end
address ispexec "LIBDEF ISPLLIB"
address ispexec "LIBDEF ISPMLIB"
address ispexec "LIBDEF ISPPLIB"
address ispexec "LIBDEF ISPSLIB"
address ispexec "LIBDEF ISPTLIB"
address ispexec "LIBDEF ISPTABL"
address tso "ALTLIB DEACT APPL(CLIST)"
address tso "FREE FI(CPXLLIB)"

@DB2I.text:
/* rexx */
/* trace i */
/*********************************************************************/
/* This exec invokes IBM's DB2I dialog.  This exec uses both ssid    */
/* and ztrail to hold the DB2 subsystem id and the nested menu       */
/* option, respectively (the nested menu option requires the         */
/* modified copy of DSNECPRI to work).  This exec shows a sample of  */
/* how to use ssid in the dataset names to allocate the correct      */
/* system-specific DB2 datasets (ssid must be 4 characters or less). */
/*********************************************************************/
parse arg ssid ztrail

                                      "'DB2."ssid".SDSNCLST')"

                                       "STACK"

                                       "STACK"

                                       "STACK"

   ztrails = 'ZTRAIL('ztrail')'
address ispexec "SELECT CMD(%DSNECPRI SSID("ssid")" ztrails ")",
                "NEWAPPL(DSNE) PASSLIB SCRNAME(DB2I"ssid")"

address ispexec "LIBDEF ISPPLIB"

address ispexec "LIBDEF ISPTLIB"

@IPCSTC1.text:
/* rexx */
/* trace i */
/*********************************************************************/
/* This exec invokes IBM's IPCS dialog with TCP/IP support.  It is   */
/* provided courtesy of Phil Knight at AIG.  Code is added to        */
/* determine the z/OS release, since TCP/IP has repackaged at both   */
/* z/OS V1R2 and z/OS V1R4.                                          */
/*********************************************************************/
parse arg ztrail
/*********************************************************************/
/* At z/OS V1R4 and higher, the CLIST library is SYS1.SBLSCLI0.      */
/*********************************************************************/
if mvsvar('sysmvs') >= 'SP7.0.4' then
   address tso "ALTLIB ACT APPL(CLIST) DA('SYS1.SBLSCLI0')"
else
   address tso "ALTLIB ACT APPL(CLIST) DA('TCPIP.SEZAINST',",
                                         "'SYS1.SBLSCLI0')"
address tso "%BLSCDDIR"
/*********************************************************************/
/* At z/OS V1R2 and higher, the load library is SYS1.MIGLIB.         */
/*********************************************************************/
if mvsvar('sysmvs') >= 'SP7.0.2' then
   address ispexec "LIBDEF ISPLLIB DATASET ID('SYS1.MIGLIB') STACK"
else
   address ispexec "LIBDEF ISPLLIB DATASET ID('TCPIP.SEZAMIG') STACK"
/*********************************************************************/
/* At z/OS V1R4 and higher, the ISPF elements are all in SYS1.SBLS*. */
/*********************************************************************/
if mvsvar('sysmvs') >= 'SP7.0.4' then
   do
      address ispexec "LIBDEF ISPMLIB DATASET ID('SYS1.SBLSMSG0') STACK"
      address ispexec "LIBDEF ISPPLIB DATASET ID('SYS1.SBLSPNL0') STACK"
      address ispexec "LIBDEF ISPTLIB DATASET ID('pref.DYNISPF.EXEC',",
                                                "'SYS1.SBLSTBL0') STACK"
   end
else
   do
      address ispexec "LIBDEF ISPMLIB DATASET ID('SYS1.SBLSMSG0',",
                                                "'TCPIP.SEZAMENU')",
                                                "STACK"
      address ispexec "LIBDEF ISPPLIB DATASET ID('SYS1.SBLSPNL0',",
                                                "'TCPIP.SEZAPENU')",
                                                "STACK"
      address ispexec "LIBDEF ISPTLIB DATASET ID('pref.DYNISPF.EXEC',",
                                                "'SYS1.SBLSPNL0',",
                                                "'SYS1.SBLSTBL0') STACK"
   end
address ispexec "LIBDEF ISPSLIB DATASET ID('SYS1.SBLSKEL0') STACK"
address ispexec "SELECT PGM(BLSG) NEWAPPL(EZBD) SCRNAME(IPCSTCP)",
                "PARM(PGM(BLSGSCMD)",
                "PARM(EXEC 'pref.DYNISPF.EXEC(@IPCSMNU)')) PASSLIB"
address ispexec "LIBDEF ISPLLIB"
address ispexec "LIBDEF ISPMLIB"
address ispexec "LIBDEF ISPPLIB"
address ispexec "LIBDEF ISPSLIB"
address ispexec "LIBDEF ISPTLIB"
address tso "ALTLIB DEACT APPL(CLIST)"
address tso "FREE FI(IPCSDDIR)"

@ISHELL.text:
/* rexx */
/*trace i*/
/*********************************************************************/
/* This exec invokes IBM's OE ISPF shell dialog.  Since ISHELL       */
/* requires a KEYLIST, save the PFSHOW value, turn PFSHOW ON, turn   */
/* keylists by setting ZKLUSE to 'Y', then restore the PFSHOW value  */
/* and ZKLUSE value before leaving.                                  */
/*********************************************************************/
parse arg ztrail
address ispexec "VGET (ZPFSHOW)"
pfshowsv = zpfshow
address ispexec "SELECT PGM(ISPOPF) PARM(PFK,ON)"
address ispexec "VGET (ZKLUSE) PROFILE"
zklusesv = zkluse
zkluse = 'Y'
address ispexec "VPUT (ZKLUSE) PROFILE"
address tso "ALTLIB ACT APPL(CLIST) DA('SYS1.SBPXEXEC')"
address ispexec "LIBDEF ISPMLIB DATASET ID('SYS1.SBPXMENU') STACK"
address ispexec "LIBDEF ISPPLIB DATASET ID('SYS1.SBPXPENU') STACK"
address ispexec "LIBDEF ISPTLIB DATASET ID('SYS1.SBPXTENU') STACK"
address ispexec "SELECT CMD(%ISHELL) SCRNAME(ISHELL)"
address ispexec "LIBDEF ISPMLIB"
address ispexec "LIBDEF ISPPLIB"

@QMF.text:
/* rexx */
/* trace i */
/*********************************************************************/
/* This exec invokes IBM's QMF dialog for QMF Version 6 and higher.  */
/* The DSQLLIB DD will be used to concatenate all necessary load     */
/* libraries, so you should no longer need Dynamic STEPLIB to enable */
/* multiple QMF subsystems.  The ztrail variable is used to prime    */
/* the DSQSSUBS value on the ISPEXEC SELECT statement.               */
/*********************************************************************/
parse arg ztrail
msgsave = msg()
x = msg('OFF')
address tso "ALLOC FI(ADMCFORM) DA('qmfpref.DSQCHART') SHR REUSE"
address tso "ALLOC FI(ADMCDATA) DA('GDDM.SADMCDA') SHR REUSE"
address tso "ALLOC FI(ADMGDF)   DA('GDDM.SADMGDF') SHR REUSE"
address tso "ALLOC FI(ADMGGMAP) DA('qmfpref.DSQMAPE') SHR REUSE"
address tso "ALLOC FI(ADMSYMBL) DA('GDDM.SADMSYM') SHR REUSE"
address tso "ALLOC FI(DSQDEBUG) DA(*) SHR REUSE"
address tso "ALLOC FI(DSQEDIT)  NEW UNIT(SYSALLDA) CYL SPACE(1 1)",
            "DSORG(PS) RECFM(F B A) LRECL(79) BLKSIZE(4029)"
address tso "ALLOC FI(DSQLLIB) DA('qmfpref.SDSQLOAD',",
                                 "'db2pref.SDSNEXIT',",
                                 "'db2pref.SDSNLOAD') SHR REUSE"
address tso "ALLOC FI(DSQPNLE)  DA('qmfpref.DSQPNLE') SHR REUSE"
address tso "ALLOC FI(DSQPRINT) DA(*) SHR REUSE"
address tso "ALLOC FI(DSQSPILL) NEW UNIT(SYSALLDA) CYL SPACE(1 1)",
            "DSORG(PS) RECFM(F) LRECL(4096) BLKSIZE(4096)"
address tso "ALLOC FI(DSQUCFRM) DA('"userid()".QMF.DSQUCFRM') SHR",
            "REUSE"
if rc <> 0 then
   address tso "ALLOC FI(DSQUCFRM) DA('"userid()".QMF.DSQUCFRM') NEW",
               "CATALOG UNIT(SYSALLDA) CYL SPACE(1 1) DIR(45)",
               "DSORG(PO) RECFM(F) LRECL(400) BLKSIZE(400)"
address tso "ALLOC FI(DSQUDUMP) SYSOUT(A) RECFM(V B A) LRECL(125)",
            "BLKSIZE(1632)"
address tso "ALLOC FI(SYSUDUMP) SYSOUT(A)"
address tso "ALTLIB ACT APPL(CLIST) DA('qmfpref.SDSQCLTE')"
address tso "ALTLIB ACT APPL(EXEC) DA('qmfpref.SDSQEXCE')"
address ispexec "LIBDEF ISPLLIB LIBRARY ID(DSQLLIB) STACK"
address ispexec "LIBDEF ISPMLIB DATASET ID('qmfpref.SDSQMLBE') STACK"
address ispexec "LIBDEF ISPPLIB DATASET ID('qmfpref.SDSQPLBE') STACK"
address ispexec "LIBDEF ISPSLIB DATASET ID('qmfpref.SDSQSLBE') STACK"
address ispexec "SELECT PGM(DSQQMFE) NEWAPPL(DSQE) PASSLIB NOCHECK",
                "SCRNAME(QMF) PARM(S="ztrail")"
address ispexec "LIBDEF ISPLLIB"
address ispexec "LIBDEF ISPMLIB"
address ispexec "LIBDEF ISPPLIB"
address ispexec "LIBDEF ISPSLIB"
address tso "ALTLIB DEACT APPL(EXEC)"
address tso "ALTLIB DEACT APPL(CLIST)"
address tso "FREE FI(ADMCDATA ADMCFORM ADMGDF   ADMSYMBL ADMGGMAP)"
address tso "FREE FI(DSQDEBUG DSQEDIT  DSQLLIB  DSQPNLE  DSQPRINT)"
address tso "FREE FI(DSQSPILL DSQUCFRM DSQUDUMP SYSUDUMP)"
x = msg(msgsave)

               "CATALOG UNIT(SYSALLDA) CYL SPACE(1 1) DIR(45)",
               "DSORG(PO) RECFM(F) LRECL(400) BLKSIZE(400)"

            "DSORG(PS) RECFM(F B A) LRECL(79) BLKSIZE(4029)"

            "BLKSIZE(1632)"
address tso "ALLOC FI(SYSUDUMP) SYSOUT(A)"
address tso "ALLOC FI(DSQSPILL) NEW UNIT(SYSALLDA) CYL SPACE(1 1)",
            "DSORG(PS) RECFM(F) LRECL(4096) BLKSIZE(4096)"

address ispexec "LIBDEF ISPSLIB DATASET ID('qmfpref.SDSQSLBE') STACK"

address tso "ALTLIB DEACT APPL(CLIST)"
address tso "FREE FI(ADMGGMAP ADMCFORM DSQUCFRM ADMCDATA ADMGDF  )"
address tso "FREE FI(ADMSYMBL DSQPNLE  DSQPRINT DSQDEBUG DSQEDIT )"
address tso "FREE FI(DSQUDUMP SYSUDUMP DSQSPILL)"

/* rexx */
/*trace i*/
/*********************************************************************/
/* This exec invokes IBM's SMP/E dialog.                             */
/*********************************************************************/

/*********************************************************************/
/* The following is added to address IR40691.  If SMP/E is already   */
/* running in split screen, the FREE FI(SMPTABL) at the end of this  */
/* exec could cause a problem for the running occurrence.  If        */
/* SMPTABL is already allocated, free it if SMP/E is not running in  */
/* split screen.                                                     */

   do
      say 'SMPTABL failed allocation - free it if SMP/E is not running',
          'in split screen'

   end

@VTAMDMP.text:
/* rexx */
/* trace i */
/*********************************************************************/
/* This exec invokes IBM's VTAM Dump Analysis IPCS Dialog.  For z/OS */
/* V1R4 and higher, IBM cleaned up the packaging and placed the      */
/* dialog elements into the IPCS libraries and the VIT load modules  */
/* into SYS1.MIGLIB.  The user profile dataset is used to hold the   */
/* user-customized tables, but you may use any dataset you wish.     */
/* For z/OS V1R3 and lower, this exec assumes you followed the       */
/* implementation instructions in the VTAM install manual, but       */
/* instead of hacking your SMP/E libraries, you allocated separate   */
/* libraries for dialog elements created by the ISPF DTL compiler.   */
/* This exec will turn on PFSHOW since neither release of the VTAM   */
/* Dump Analysis dialogs turns on PFSHOW.                            */
/*********************************************************************/
parse arg ztrail
address ispexec "VGET (ZPFSHOW)"
pfshowsv = zpfshow
address ispexec "SELECT PGM(ISPOPF) PARM(PFK,ON)"
if mvsvar('sysmvs') >= 'SP7.0.4' then
   do
      address tso "ALTLIB ACT APPL(EXEC) DA('SYS1.SBLSCLI0')"
      address tso "ALTLIB ACT APPL(CLIST) DA('SYS1.SBLSCLI0')"
      address ispexec "LIBDEF ISPLLIB DATASET ID('SYS1.MIGLIB') STACK"
      address ispexec "LIBDEF ISPMLIB DATASET ID('SYS1.SBLSMSG0') STACK"
      address ispexec "LIBDEF ISPPLIB DATASET ID('SYS1.SBLSPNL0') STACK"
      address ispexec "LIBDEF ISPTABL DATASET",
                      "ID('"userid()".ISPF.ISPPROF') STACK"
      address ispexec "LIBDEF ISPTLIB DATASET",
                      "ID('"userid()".ISPF.ISPPROF','SYS1.SBLSTBL0')",
                      "STACK"
      address ispexec "SELECT CMD(%ISTDE01 "ztrail") NEWAPPL(ISTD)",
                      "PASSLIB NOCHECK SCRNAME(VTAMDUMP)"
   end
else
   do
      address tso "ALTLIB ACT APPL(CLIST) DA('pref.DYNISPF.EXEC',",
                                            "'SYS1.SISTCLI0',",
                                            "'SYS1.SISTCLS1')"
      address ispexec "LIBDEF ISPLLIB DATASET ID('SYS1.SISTDBUG') STACK"
      address ispexec "LIBDEF ISPMLIB DATASET ID('SYS1.SISTMSG0',",
                                                "'vtamtrac.MESSAGES')",
                                                "STACK"
      address ispexec "LIBDEF ISPPLIB DATASET ID('SYS1.SISTPNL0',",
                                                "'vtamtrac.PANELS')",
                                                "STACK"
      address ispexec "LIBDEF ISPTABL DATASET ID('vtamtrac.TABLES')",
                                                "STACK"
      address ispexec "LIBDEF ISPTLIB DATASET ID('vtamtrac.TABLES')",
                                                "STACK"
      address ispexec "SELECT CMD(%@VTAMDM1 "ztrail") NEWAPPL(ISTD)",
                      "PASSLIB NOCHECK SCRNAME(VTAMDUMP)"
   end
address ispexec "SELECT PGM(ISPOPF) PARM(PFK,"pfshowsv")"
address ispexec "LIBDEF ISPLLIB"
address ispexec "LIBDEF ISPMLIB"
address ispexec "LIBDEF ISPPLIB"
address ispexec "LIBDEF ISPTABL"
address ispexec "LIBDEF ISPTLIB"
address tso "ALTLIB DEACT APPL(CLIST)"
if mvsvar('sysmvs') >= 'SP7.0.4' then
   address tso "ALTLIB DEACT APPL(EXEC)"

ABRALLOC.text:
PROC 0 CMD() OPT() TRAIL() DSNAMES +
               CLIST(FDRPREF.CLIST)  +
               LLIB(FDRPREF.LOAD)  +
               PLIB(FDRPREF.PANELS)  +
               MLIB(FDRPREF.MESSAGES)  +
               SLIB(FDRPREF.SKELETON)  +
               ILIB(FDRPREF.ICL)  +
               JLIB(FDRPREF.JCL)  +
               TOD(12345678) +
               STEPLIB(YES) +
               APPL()
        CONTROL PROMPT MAIN
        CONTROL LIST CONLIST SYMLIST
        IF &STR(&CMD) = VPUT THEN DO
          SET &FDRCLIB = &STR(&CLIST)
          SET &FDRLLIB = &STR(&LLIB)
          SET &FDRPLIB = &STR(&PLIB)
          SET &FDRMLIB = &STR(&MLIB)
          SET &FDRSLIB = &STR(&SLIB)
          SET &FDRILIB = &STR(&ILIB)
          SET &FDRJLIB = &STR(&JLIB)
          SET &INSITO  = &STR(&TOD)
          SET &INSTEP  = &STR(&STEPLIB)
          ISPEXEC VPUT (FDRCLIB FDRLLIB FDRPLIB FDRMLIB FDRSLIB +
            FDRILIB FDRJLIB INSITO INSTEP) SHARED
          EXIT CODE(0)
        END
        IF &STR(&DSNAMES) ¬= THEN DO
          IF &SUBSTR(1:3,&SYSISPF   ) ¬= NOT THEN DO
            ISPEXEC CONTROL ERRORS RETURN
            ISPEXEC VPUT (CLIST LLIB PLIB MLIB SLIB ILIB JLIB +
              STEPLIB) SHARED
            ISPEXEC SELECT CMD(%FDRDSNFC SYSPROC ABRALLOC)
            ISPEXEC SELECT PANEL(FDRDSN)
            IF &LASTCC < 12 THEN EXIT CODE(0)
          END
          CONTROL NOMSG NOFLUSH
          %FDRDSN CLIST('&CLIST') LLIB('&LLIB') PLIB('&PLIB') +
            C1 MLIB('&MLIB') SLIB('&SLIB') ILIB('&ILIB') +
            C2 JLIB('&JLIB') STEPLIB('&STEPLIB')
          IF &LASTCC = 0 THEN EXIT CODE(0)
          LOOP: IF &STR(&CLIST) = THEN GOTO PROMPT
          EXEC '&CLIST(FDRDSN)' 'CLIST(''&CLIST'') LLIB(''&LLIB'') +
            C1 PLIB(''&PLIB'') MLIB(''&MLIB'') SLIB(''&SLIB'') +
            C2 ILIB(''&ILIB'') JLIB(''&JLIB'') STEPLIB(''&STEPLIB'')'
          IF &LASTCC = 0 THEN EXIT CODE(0)
          CONTROL MSG
          PROMPT: WRITE FDRW49 PLEASE ENTER THE FULLY QUALIFIED FDR +
                DIALOG CLIST LIBRARY DATA SET NAME:
          READ &CLIST
          GOTO LOOP
        END
        /*
        ATTN EXIT
        DO WHILE &STR(&CLIST) =  OR &LASTCC ¬=0
          WRITE FDRW49 PLEASE ENTER THE FULLY QUALIFIED FDR +
                DIALOG CLIST LIBRARY DATA SET NAME:
          READ &CLIST
          ALLOC DA('&CLIST') SHR
          END
        DO WHILE &STR(&LLIB) =  OR &LASTCC ¬=0
          WRITE FDRW49 PLEASE ENTER THE FULLY QUALIFIED FDR +
                PROGRAM LIBRARY DATA SET NAME:
          READ &LLIB
          ALLOC DA('&LLIB') SHR
          END
        DO WHILE &STR(&PLIB) =  OR &LASTCC ¬=0
          WRITE FDRW49 PLEASE ENTER THE FULLY QUALIFIED FDR +
                DIALOG PANEL LIBRARY DATA SET NAME:
          READ &PLIB
          ALLOC DA('&PLIB') SHR
          END
        DO WHILE &STR(&MLIB) =  OR &LASTCC ¬=0
          WRITE FDRW49 PLEASE ENTER THE FULLY QUALIFIED FDR +
                DIALOG MESSAGES LIBRARY DATA SET NAME:
          READ &MLIB
          ALLOC DA('&MLIB') SHR
          END
        DO WHILE &STR(&SLIB) =  OR &LASTCC ¬=0
          WRITE FDRW49 PLEASE ENTER THE FULLY QUALIFIED FDR +
                DIALOG SKELETON LIBRARY DATA SET NAME:
          READ &SLIB
          ALLOC DA('&SLIB') SHR
          END
        /*
        IF &STR(&CMD) ¬= OR &STR(&SYSISPF) = ACTIVE THEN DO
          CALL '&LLIB(FDRLOAD)' 'ALTLIB'
          SET &ALTLIB = &LASTCC
          IF &ALTLIB = 1 +
            THEN ALTLIB ACT APPLICATION(CLIST) DATASET('&CLIST')
            ELSE CALL '&LLIB(FDRLOAD)' 'SYSPROC,&CLIST'
          IF &STR(&STEPLIB) = YES THEN DO
            CALL '&LLIB(FDRLOAD)' 'ABRLLIB,&LLIB'
            ISPEXEC LIBDEF ISPLLIB LIBRARY ID(ABRLLIB)
          END
          /* MODIFY LIBDEF STATEMENTS TO USE STACK FOR DYNAMIC ISPF */
          /* CONLEY 2002/08/31                                      */
          ISPEXEC LIBDEF ISPPLIB DATASET ID('&PLIB') STACK
          ISPEXEC LIBDEF ISPMLIB DATASET ID('&MLIB') STACK
          ISPEXEC LIBDEF ISPSLIB DATASET ID('&SLIB') STACK
          IF &STR(&OPT) = THEN DO
            SET &ZTRAIL =
            SET &ZENVIR =
            ISPEXEC VGET (ZTRAIL,ZENVIR)
            IF &STR(&TRAIL) ¬= THEN SET &ZTRAIL = &STR(&TRAIL)
            IF &SUBSTR(6:8,&ZENVIR) = &STR(2.2) +
              THEN ISPEXEC SELECT PANEL(ABRPRIM2) OPT(&STR(&ZTRAIL)) +
                   NEWPOOL
              ELSE ISPEXEC SELECT PANEL(ABRPRIME) OPT(&STR(&ZTRAIL)) +
                   NEWPOOL
            END
          ELSE +
            ISPEXEC SELECT CMD(%ABRINPRI OPT(&STR(&OPT)) APPL(&APPL))
          IF &ALTLIB = 1 THEN ALTLIB DEACTIVATE APPLICATION(CLIST)
          IF &STR(&STEPLIB) = YES THEN DO
            ISPEXEC LIBDEF ISPLLIB
            FREE F(ABRLLIB)
          END
          ISPEXEC LIBDEF ISPPLIB
          ISPEXEC LIBDEF ISPMLIB
          ISPEXEC LIBDEF ISPSLIB
          EXIT CODE(0)
        END
        IF &STR(&STEPLIB) = YES THEN DO
          CONTROL NOMSG
          FREE F(ABRLLIB)
          CONTROL MSG
          CALL '&LLIB(FDRLOAD)' 'ISPLLIB,&LLIB'
        END
        CALL '&LLIB(FDRLOAD)' 'SYSPROC,&CLIST'
        CALL '&LLIB(FDRLOAD)' 'ISPPLIB,&PLIB'
        CALL '&LLIB(FDRLOAD)' 'ISPMLIB,&MLIB'
        CALL '&LLIB(FDRLOAD)' 'ISPSLIB,&SLIB'
        ISPF PANEL(ISR@V3X)

IKJTSO00.text:
/* LIB: CPAC.PARMLIB(IKJTSO00)                                     */
/* DOC: THIS MEMBER IS USED AT IPL TIME TO DEFINE THE AUTHORIZED   */
/*      COMMAND LIST, THE AUTHORIZED PROGRAM LIST, THE NOT         */
/*      BACKGROUND COMMAND LIST, THE AUTHORIZED BY THE TSO SERVICE */
/*      FACILITY LIST, AND TO CREATE THE DEFAULTS THE SEND COMMAND */
/*      WILL USE.                                                  */
/*                                                                 */
AUTHCMD NAMES(          /* AUTHORIZED COMMANDS      */      +
   AD       ADDSD       /* RACF COMMANDS            */ +
   AG       ADDGROUP    /*                          */ +
   AU       ADDUSER     /*                          */ +
   ALG      ALTGROUP    /*                          */ +
   ALD      ALTDSD      /*                          */ +
   ALU      ALTUSER     /*                          */ +
   BLKUPD               /*                          */ +
   CO       CONNECT     /*                          */ +
   DD       DELDSD      /*                          */ +
   DG       DELGROUP    /*                          */ +
   DU       DELUSER     /*                          */ +
   LD       LISTDSD     /*                          */ +
   LG       LISTGRP     /*                          */ +
   LU       LISTUSER    /*                          */ +
   RACDCERT             /*                          */ +
   RALT     RALTER      /*                          */ +
   RACLINK              /*                          */ +
   RDEF     RDEFINE     /*                          */ +
   RDEL     RDELETE     /*                          */ +
   RE       REMOVE      /*                          */ +
   RL       RLIST       /*                          */ +
   RVARY                /*                          */ +
   PASSWORD PW          /*                          */ +
   PE       PERMIT      /*                          */ +
   SETR     SETROPTS    /*                          */ +
   SR       SEARCH      /*                          */ +
   IRRDPI00             /*                          */ +
   DITTO                /* DITTO                    */ +
   DITTOA               /* DITTO                    */ +
   DITTOU               /* DITTO                    */ +
   IEBCOPY              /*                          */ +
   BINDDATA BDATA       /*  DMSMS COMMANDS          */ +
   LISTDATA LDATA       /*                          */ +
   SETCACHE SETC        /*                          */ +
   RECEIVE              /* TSO COMMANDS             */ +
   CONSPROF             /*                          */ +
   TRANSMIT XMIT        /*                          */ +
   LISTB    LISTBC      /*                          */ +
   SE       SEND        /*                          */ +
   RACONVRT CONSPROF    /*                          */ +
   SYNC                 /*                          */ +
   LISTD    LISTDS      /*                          */ +
   TESTAUTH TESTA       /*                          */ +
   PARMLIB  IKJPRMLB    /*                          */ +
   NETSTAT              /* IP COMMANDS              */ +
   TRACERTE             /* IP COMMANDS              */ +
   MVPXDISP            /* IP COMMAND                */)
                        /*                          */
AUTHPGM NAMES(          /* AUTHORIZED PROGRAMS      */      +
   ICHUT100             /*                          */ +
   ICHUT200             /*                          */ +
   ICHUT400             /*                          */ +
   ICHDSM00             /*                          */ +
   IRRDSC00             /*                          */ +
   IRRUT100             /*                          */ +
   IRRUT200             /*                          */ +
   IRRUT400             /*                          */ +
   IRRDPI00             /*                          */ +
   CSFDAUTH           /* ICSF COMMAND             */ +
   ICADCT             /* FIREWALL                 */ +
   ICADDCT            /* FIREWALL                 */ +
   ICADCFGS           /* FIREWALL                 */ +
   ICADPFTP           /* FIREWALL                 */ +
   ICADFTPD           /* FIREWALL                 */ +
   ICADSLOG           /* FIREWALL                 */ +
   ICADSOCK           /* FIREWALL                 */ +
   ICADSOXD           /* FIREWALL                 */ +
   ICADSTAK           /* FIREWALL                 */ +
   ICADIKED           /* FIREWALL                 */ +
   IEBCOPY              /*                          */ +
   IOEGRWAG           /* DFS                      */ +
   IOENEWAG           /* DFS                      */ +
   IOESALVG           /* DFS                      */ +
   IOEBAK             /* DFS                      */ +
   IOEBOS             /* DFS                      */ +
   IOECM              /* DFS                      */ +
   IOEDCEER           /* DFS                      */ +
   IOEDFSXP           /* DFS                      */ +
   IOEFTS             /* DFS                      */ +
   IOEMAPID           /* DFS                      */ +
   IOESCOUT           /* DFS                      */ +
   IOEUDBG            /* DFS                      */)
                        /*                          */
NOTBKGND NAMES(         /* COMMANDS WHICH MAY NOT BE */  +
                        /* ISSUED IN THE BACKGROUND  */  +
   OPER     OPERATOR    /*                           */ +
   TERM     TERMINAL    /*                           */)
                        /*                           */
AUTHTSF NAMES(          /* PROGRAMS TO BE AUTHORIZED */  +
                        /* WHEN CALLED THROUGH THE   */  +
                        /* TSO SERVICE FACILITY.     */  +
   CSFDAUTH             /* ICSF                     */ +
   IEBCOPY              /*                          */ +
   ICQASLI0             /*                          */ +
   IKJEFF76             /*                          */)
                        /*                           */
SEND                    /* SEND COMMAND DEFAULTS     */  +
   OPERSEND(ON)         /*                           */ +
   USERSEND(ON)         /*                           */ +
   SAVE(ON)             /*                           */ +
   CHKBROD(OFF)         /*                           */ +
   LOGNAME(SYS1.BRODCAST)  /*                        */

ALLOCATE                /* ALLOCATE COMMAND DEFAULT  */ +
   DEFAULT(OLD)         /*                           */

TRANSREC                   /*                        */ +
   NODESMF((NODENAME,SMF)) /*                        */ +
   CIPHER(YES)          /*                           */ +
   SPOOLCL(B)           /*                           */ +
   OUTWARN(50000,15000) /*                           */ +
   OUTLIM(5000000)      /*                           */ +
   VIO(SYSALLDA)        /*                           */ +
   LOGSEL(LOG)          /*                           */ +
   LOGNAME(MISC)        /*                           */ +
   DAPREFIX(TUPREFIX)   /*                           */ +
   USRCTL(NAMES.TEXT)   /*                           */ +
   SYSOUT(*)            /*                           */

CONSOLE INITUNUM(1000)            /* CONSOLE COMMAND DEFAULTS      */ +
        INITSNUM(1000)            /*                               */ +
        MAXUNUM(10000)            /*                               */ +
        MAXSNUM(10000)            /*                               */

PLATCMD NAMES(                    /* COMMANDS TO BE INVOKED        */ +
                                  /* VIA THE TSO COMMAND           */ +
                                  /* INVOCATION PLATFORM           */ +
                                  /* (COMMANDS IN THIS             */ +
                                  /*  LIST MUST NOT REQUIRE        */ +
                                  /*  TASK TERMINATION             */ +
                                  /*  CLEANUP PROCESSING)          */ +
   ALLOCATE ALLOC                 /*                               */ +
   ALTLIB            IKJADLIB     /*                               */ +
   ATTRIB   ATTR                  /*                               */ +
   CALL              IKJEFG00     /*                               */ +
   EXEC     EX       IKJEXC2      /*                               */ +
   FREE     UNALLOC               /*                               */ +
   PRINTDS  PR       IKJEFY50     /*                               */ +
   PROFILE  PROF                  /*                               */ +
   SUBMIT   SUB                   /*                               */ +
   STATUS   ST       IKJEFFCA     /*                               */ +
   LISTBC   LISTB                 /*  AUTHORIZED COMMANDS          */ +
   PARMLIB  IKJPRMLB              /* (THESE COMMANDS MUST          */ +
   RECEIVE                        /* BE LISTED IN AUTHCMD          */ +
   SEND     SE                    /* STATEMENT OR IKJEFTE2         */ +
   TRANSMIT XMIT                  /* TABLE)                        */ +
   SYNC                           /*                               */ +
   RACONVRT                       /*                               */ +
   CONSPROF)                      /*                               */

HELP    ENU(SYS1.HELP             /* HELP COMMAND DEFAULTS         */ +
            ISP.SISPHELP          /* ISPF HELP                     */ +
            SYS1.SBDTHELP         /* BULK DATA TRANSFER HELP       */ +
                    )

PLATPGM NAMES(                    /* PROGRAMS TO BE INVOKED        */ +
   IEFBR14                        /* VIA THE TSO COMMAND/PROGRAM   */ +
                                  /* INVOCATION PLATFORM           */ +
                                  /* (PROGRAMS IN THIS             */ +
                                  /*  LIST MUST NOT REQUIRE        */ +
                                  /*  TASK TERMINATION             */ +
                                  /*  CLEANUP PROCESSING)          */ +
                                  /*                               */ +
   IKJEFF76)                      /*  AUTHORIZED PROGRAMS          */ +
                                  /* (THESE PROGRAMS MUST          */ +
                                  /* BE LISTED IN AUTHTSF          */ +
                                  /* OR THE IKJEFTAP TABLE)        */ +
                                  /*                               */

ISMPANL.text:
)BODY EXPAND(!!)
%!-! Legent Integrated Storage Management !-!
%OPTION  ===>_ZCMD
%
%   M +MASTERCAT   - Mastercat from Legent Corp.
%   V +VSAMAID     - Vsamaid from Legent Corp.
)INIT
  .HELP = ISR00003
)PROC
&ZQ = &Z
IF (&ZCMD <> ' ')
   &ZQ = TRUNC(&ZCMD,'.')
   &ZTRAIL = .TRAIL
   IF (&ZQ = ' ')
      .MSG = ISRU000
&ZSEL = TRANS( &ZQ
        M,'CMD(ISMISPF MCAT &ZTRAIL) NEWAPPL(MCAT) NOCHECK PASSLIB'
        V,'CMD(ISMISPF VAID &ZTRAIL) NEWAPPL(VAID) NOCHECK PASSLIB'
        ' ',' '
        X,'EXIT'
        *,'?' )
)END

ISR@PUL2.text:
<:-- Panel logic customization member for panel ISR@PRIM             -->
<:-- Place all logic to be executed AFTER the standard panel logic   -->
<:-- used by ISR@PRIM here.                                          -->
<:-- You can include all logic for )INIT and )REINIT sections here.  -->
<:-- Place all logic for )PROC to be executed before the standard    -->
<:-- ZSEL option selection processing here.                          -->
<:-- Align logic starting in column 1 to avoid processing conflicts. -->
<:--                                                                 -->
<source type=proc>
&ZQ = &Z
IF (&ZCMD ¬= ' ')
   &ZQ = TRUNC(&ZCMD,'.')

OY59638.text:
Note:  I'm leaving this in here just for reference.  The workaround is
       to use the QUEUE command to invoke ISPF.  That will run ISPF
       directly from native TSO instead of running ISPF under REXX.

APAR OY59638





  APAR Identifier ...... OY59638      Last Changed ........ 93/06/03
  REXX EXEC FROM EXEC IKJEFT01,PARM= THAT INVOKES ISPF/PDF WILL
  NOT ALLOW ATTENTION FROM PLATFORM OR AUTHORIZED COMMAND

  Symptom ...... IN INCORROUT         Status ........... CLOSED  SUG
  Severity ................... 2      Date Closed ......... 93/05/28
  Component .......... 566528502      Duplicate of ........
  Reported Release ......... 3D2      Fixed Release ............
  Component Name TSO/E SCHEDULAR      Special Notice
  Current Target Date ..              Flags
  SCP ...................
  Platform ............

  Status Detail: ASSIGNMENT - APAR has been assigned to a
                              programmer.

  PE PTF List:

  PTF List:


  Parent APAR:
  Child APAR list:


  ERROR DESCRIPTION:
  Using TSO/E logon proc with a PARM= option that executes a REXX
  exec to take you directly into ISPF and then hitting attention
  from within an authorized command or program may result in
  MSGIKJ56605I ATTENTION INTERRUPTS WILL NOT BE PROCESSED UNITL
  THE FIRST COMMAND FROM THE LOGON PROCEDURE HAS COMPLETED.
  .
  Results may differ when using the TSO/E PLATFORM facility
  ( TSO/E Parmlib member IKJTSOxx with comands and/or programs
  specified in PLATCMD and/or PLATPGM )
  .
  SAMPLE logon PROC used to recreate the problem:
  //JOS320 EXEC PGM=IKJEFT01,
  //             PERFORM=2,
  //             REGION=4096K,
  //             DYNAMNBR=15,
  //             TIME=1440,
  // PARM='EXEC ''JO.EXEC(TESTING)'''
  .
  .
  SAMPLE REXX EXEC USED TO RECREATE PROBLEM:
  /*  REXX EXEC IN JO.EXEC(TESTING)   */
  'ISPF'
  /*  END OF SAMPLE REXX EXEC         */
  .
  STEPS USED TO RECREATE THE PROBLEM:
  1.  Define a user to allow use of the sample logon proc
  2.  Logon to that user.  This will take you directly to
      ISPF main panel.
  3.  From the command line enter:
      TSO TRANSMIT
  4.  You will then be prompted for information for the
      TRANSMIT command.  Hit attention at this prompt
  5.  This results in MSGIKJ56605I
  6.  If you then allow the TRANSMIT command to complete,
      and then retest, you will find that this second
      attention completes as expected.
  .
  When the PLATFORM facility is in effect, entering the command
  repeatedly never allows the attention to complete as expected.
  All attention interrupts of authorized commands and/or programs
  running off the PLATFORM result in MSGIKJ56605I.


  LOCAL FIX:
  Modify logon proc to use a front-end CLIST


  PROBLEM SUMMARY:


  PROBLEM CONCLUSION:


  TEMPORARY FIX:


  COMMENTS:
  YOUR SUGGESTION HAS BEEN ACCEPTED AND WILL BE CONSIDERED FOR
  INCLUSION IN A FUTURE RELEASE/PRODUCT.


  MODULES/MACROS:


  SRLS:


  RTN CODES:


  CIRCUMVENTION:


  MESSAGE TO SUBMITTER:

TBPRIM.text:
)ATTR
           /*    tableBASE Release 5.1    */
           /* Modified by Conley for DISS */
)BODY
%----------------------- tablesONLINE PRIMARY MENU (5.1) -----------------------
%COMMAND ===>_ZCMD                                                             +
%
%                                                           +USERID - &ZUSER
%                                                           +DATE   - &TBDATE
%                                                           +TIME   - &ZTIME
%                                                           +TSOPREFIX- &ZPREFIX
%
% 1 +BROWSE TABLE  - Display a table using full screen (ISPF Browse)
% 2 +BROWSE ROWS   - Display rows in a table
% 3 +EDIT ROWS     - Add, change or delete rows in a table
% 4 +DEFINE TABLE  - Add/chg/del a table and/or view or create Alternate
% 5 +UTILITIES     - Manipulate tables
% 6 +TBDRIVER      - Process TBLBASE commands
%
%
%
%
+   Press%HELP+on any screen for online help text.
%
+   Press%END+to end tablesONLINE.
)INIT
  .HELP  = TBPRIMH
  &TBDATE = '&ZSTDYEAR./&ZMONTH./&ZDAY'
  &ZHTOP = TBPRIMH
  &ZIND  = TBPRIMH
)PROC
  &ZQ = &Z
  IF (&ZCMD ¬= ' ')
     &ZQ = TRUNC(&ZCMD,'.')
     &ZTRAIL = .TRAIL
     IF (&ZQ = ' ')
        .MSG = ISRU000
  &ZSEL = TRANS ( &ZQ
         1,'PGM(TBONLINE) PARM(1) NEWAPPL(DKTB) PASSLIB'
         2,'PGM(TBONLINE) PARM(2) NEWAPPL(DKTB) PASSLIB'
         3,'PGM(TBONLINE) PARM(3) NEWAPPL(DKTB) PASSLIB'
         4,'PGM(TBONLINE) PARM(4) NEWAPPL(DKTB) PASSLIB'
         5,'PANEL(TBUTIL)         NEWAPPL(DKTB) PASSLIB'
         6,'CMD(%TBDRIVER)        NEWAPPL(DKTB) PASSLIB'
        ' ',' '
         *,'?'        )
)END
